intro: Psychotria lehmbachii, commonly known as the Amazonian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil, Peru, and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces berries that are typically bright red when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. Psychotria lehmbachii is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
